name: expressionism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a style of art, music, or writing, beginning in the 1900s, that tries to express feelings and emotions rather than trying to accurately represent how things appear: Bohrod dismissed abstract expressionism and other major postwar art movements. Van Gogh was one of the pioneers of Expressionism, and he used colour primarily for its emotive appeal. Related words
expressionist
expressionistic
expressionistically
More examplesFewer examplesThe uncompromising expressionism of free jazz is somewhat specialist.Guston, born in 1913, was a key exponent of abstract expressionism.His paintings look like Picasso and Expressionism, but stranger.
